intro: Meresaldia, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Meresaldia is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant color and ability to attract pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soil and full to partial sunlight.
